Posts.EditableText:
Hi, everyone.

I am writing a squiffy game.
It is big game. Over 2000 lines.

I can make Javascript file from it.
But after save the game and I reload it from "My Games" screen,
I can edit less than 2000 lines.
Over 2000 lines are deleted.

Squiffy editor can treat less than 2000 lines?
Do I need to save the text file on local PC?

NOTICE: I am not good at English. Please forgive me if there are some English mistakes.

Posts.EditableText:
Okay.
May be Download version has no problem.
It can treat over 2700 lines.
Online version is limited under about 2000 lines.

Posts.EditableText:
I'm moving towards hitting this too. I'm at about 1300 lines and really getting rolling. Using the download/offline version. 2700s all we got?

Really, given some of the inefficiencies of the language (hey, it's simple, but its sorta sledgehammer coding), I burn lines at a very quick clip.

Posts.EditableText:
There is no limit to the number of lines you can use.

If something weird happens with big files then that's a bug so let me know and I'll look into it.
Posts.HTML:
There is no limit to the number of lines you can use.

If something weird happens with big files then that's a bug so let me know and I'll look into it.

Posts.EditableText: Fantastic. I'd read this and it had been in the back of my mind while developing. Now that I know I'm not going to hit a wall, full speed ahead! Thanks, Alex!
